001package gust.backend.model;
002
003import com.google.common.util.concurrent.ListeningScheduledExecutorService;
004import com.google.protobuf.Message;
005import gust.backend.runtime.ReactiveFuture;
006
007import javax.annotation.Nonnull;
008import java.util.Optional;
009
010
011/**
012 * Describes the surface of a <i>cache driver</i>, which is a partner object to a {@link PersistenceDriver} specifically
013 * tailored to deal with caching engines. Cache drivers may be used with any {@link ModelAdapter} implementation for
014 * transparent read-through caching support.
015 *
016 * <p>Caches implemented in this manner are expected to adhere to options defined on {@link CacheOptions}, particularly
017 * with regard to eviction and timeouts. Specific implementations may extend that interface to define custom options,
018 * which may be provided to the implementation at runtime either via stubbed options parameters or app config.</p>
019 */
020@SuppressWarnings("UnstableApiUsage")
021public interface CacheDriver<Key extends Message, Model extends Message> {
022  /**
023   * Write a record ({@code model}) at {@code key} into the cache, overwriting any model currently stored at the same
024   * key, if applicable. The resulting future completes with no value, when the cache write has finished, to let the
025   * framework know the cache is done following up.
026   *
027   * @param key Key for the record we should inject into the cache.
028   * @param model Record data to inject into the cache.
029   * @param executor Executor to use for any async operations.
030   * @return Future, which simply completes when the write is done.
031   */
032  @Nonnull ReactiveFuture injectRecord(@Nonnull Key key,
033                                       @Nonnull Model model,
034                                       @Nonnull ListeningScheduledExecutorService executor);
035
036  /**
037   * Attempt to resolve a known model, addressed by {@code key}, from the cache powered/backed by this driver, according
038   * to {@code options} and making use of {@code executor}.
039   *
040   * <p>If no value is available in the cache, {@link Optional#empty()} must be returned, which triggers a call to the
041   * driver to resolve the record. If the record can be fetched originally, it will later be added to the cache by a
042   * separate call to {@link #injectRecord(Message, Message, ListeningScheduledExecutorService)}.</p>
043   *
044   * @param key Key for the record which we should look for in the cache.
045   * @param options Options to apply to the fetch routine taking place.
046   * @param executor Executor to use for async tasks. Provided by the driver or adapter.
047   * @return Future value, which resolves either to {@link Optional#empty()} or a wrapped result value.
048   */
049  @Nonnull ReactiveFuture<Optional<Model>> fetchCached(@Nonnull Key key,
050                                                       @Nonnull FetchOptions options,
051                                                       @Nonnull ListeningScheduledExecutorService executor);
052}
